div.p: RB MSS M41, Library, Royal Botanic Gardens Melbourne.

It is very kind of you, dear Miss Henderson, to bear my birthday in such friendly remembrance. Let me thank you for all your good wishes, the highest of which are to be worthy of the esteem of the just, to maintain strenght for work and to finish my great literary labors.
Let me also hope that your health is firm and that you enjoy fully your prosperous independence. Your stay in town will give you the opportunity for much pleasures.

I shall always value the little picture you so considerately sent.
Picture not identified.
Pray give to Mrs & Mr M'Haffie the expression of my full respect.
